reviews.text: A good hotel for a couple of nights and, let's face it, that's about as long as you'd want to stay in Brussels if you're sightseeing.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel Great Location
Terrible Treatment. Got our bag stolen from Lobby and were treated like liers
reviews.text: Best bit - location. Worst bit - a little pricey for what it is. But, overall, no complaints.

The hotel is nice, but the manager accused us of lying when we told him that our bag which had our passports in it was stolen from the hotel lobby where my mother was sitting. He took me out side the hotel and told me how could I prove that it was the case and i could have lost it elsewhere and claimed that it happened in the hotel. There are cameras in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can go on to describe the rest of the experience, but I think the manager was highly unprofessional and unfriendly and does not know how to treat his clients. I have filed an official complaint with Marriot which i believe is a professional service providers in the US, but the Brussels one is a shame.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Stayed overnight at this hotel, rooms & service very good, free parking at weekends, close to city centre & attractions.
reviews.title: As good as it gets in Brussels

reviews.text: Before people jump at me for being unkind, and that's to the location, let me qualify:
reviews.title: OK Hotel + Subpar Location = Totally Skippable

reviews.text: 1. Yes, the hotel is essentially across the street from the Grand Place.
reviews.title: Very comfortable with great service & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. In my opinion, the Grand Place and the surrounding area is filthy and over-run by tourists and souvenir peddlers and is congested in a manner which can only be compared to Times Square on new years' eve. Once you're bored with the Grand Place, you're not going to have too much left to explore in the Marriott surroundings (see point #3 below) and wherever you go, you'll end up having to deal with wading through the human soup of the main square. Personally, I'm not a big fan of that.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. The areas directly to the left, right and behind the hotel are generally shabby - and not in the artistic way, but in a manner that makes one feel a bit uncomfortable... For non-believers, take a stroll within the three block radius and it'll become painfully obvious.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: 4. For people in town on business, the train situation isn't that great. The closest stations are about 15 minutes away (Gare du Nord, Gare Centrale, Gare Midi), but considering the fact that Brussels (and Belgium in general) is one of the least predictable and most rain-filled regions in Europe, that 15 minute walk very often has a tendency of turning into a soggy and uncomfortable trek.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The location of this hotel makes it! It is located in a very central location -- near the sights, restaurants, and transportation. The hotel staff was attentive -- both those at the front desk and at the lounge, etc.
reviews.title: Business Trip to Brussels

reviews.text: The rooms are a bit small, but comfortable. I'm tall and I had a bit of a challenge in the shower. There was a slanted ceiling that made showering a little challenge.
reviews.title: Typical Marriott surprised by hotel crime

reviews.text: The executive lounge was nice and well equipped. The fitness room was mediocre at best. It had enough space, but the machines and weights are pretty limited.
reviews.title: Quiet and comfortable in downtown Brussels

reviews.text: The room was typical Marriott. Enjoyed the atmosphere but the location at night was a little frightening and to top it off...during my stay my purse was stolen out of my room within three minutes of me accidently leaving it there. Management tried to help but not sincerely. The police said it is a common thing that happens and they can't do anything about it.
reviews.title: Excellent location and wonderful hotel with standard Marriott quality

reviews.text: The Marriott's in downtown Brussels is all about location. It's right in the heart of the old city, directly across from the Stock Exchange, only minutes walking from many things to see and do in the City. Even in this bustling location our room, 557, high and in the back of the hotel was wonderfully quiet. Even the air conditioner barely made a whisper.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights I was staying in another hotel that was a total dive, so I decided to stay in the hotel instead. The check in was very quick, even though I only booked online a few hours before I checked in, they did not have the type of room I requested, a king bed, I got 2 single beds which was lovely. Everything in the hotel is expensive. For breakfast I went to the two supermarkets around the corner and put what I bought in the mini fridge. The location of the hotel is fantastic, you can walk to all of the sights within 10 minutes, Hotel left very safe which is something you want as a solo traveler. Staff were very helpful, they booked a cab for me to get to the airport and they told me where to go for a nice meal with friends I met up with.
reviews.title: Best hotel I've stayed in a long time

reviews.text: I just completed a three night stay here and found it to be a great value. The location is great with the tram station right outside and many tourist attractions within walking distance. The rooms are pretty standard for Marriots, no frills but were very clean. Two things that I did not like were 1) Took entirely too long to check in with absolutely no line (about 15 minutes) which is very painful after a full day of travel 2) Internet access is very expensive almost 20 Euros for a day. Save yourself some money and use the free Wi-Fi next door at the McDonalds.
reviews.title: Great value for a great location

reviews.text: If you can get a good rate then this is a decent place to stay. Everything at the hotel is expensive, especially breakfast!!
reviews.title: Its a decent hotel with excellent location

reviews.text: Great location. Terrible for parking on the street, usually have to park about 5 blocks away to find a spot and make sure your moving the car before 9am during the week otherwise you'll get a ticket!
reviews.title: "Location is the Best"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Workout room is just ok - they should do better. Executive lounge is decent but somewhat dissappointing in terms of the food they served at breakfast.
